vulnerability.name: USN-4665-2
vulnerability.description: USN-4665-1 fixed several vulnerabilities in curl. This update provides the corresponding update for Ubuntu 12.04 ESM and Ubuntu 14.04 ESM.  Original advisory details:   Varnavas Papaioannou discovered that curl incorrectly handled FTP PASV  responses. An attacker could possibly use this issue to trick curl into  connecting to an arbitrary IP address and be used to perform port scanner  and other information gathering. (CVE-2020-8284)   It was discovered that curl incorrectly handled FTP wildcard matchins. A  remote attacker could possibly use this issue to cause curl to consume  resources and crash, resulting in a denial of service. (CVE-2020-8285)

statements.status_notes: Several security issues were fixed in curl. Available with Ubuntu Pro.
